types1:Item.types1:Name: UncaughtFaultAlertHandler-NA
types1:Item.types1:Description: Process Engine Fault Alert handler allows to send notifcations based on declarative conditions Faults can be ignored

process.name: UncaughtFaultAlertHandler-NA
process.description: Process Engine Fault Alert handler allows to send notifcations based on declarative conditions Faults can be ignored

field.description: Configuration Output with rures outcomes included
field.name: AlertHandlerOutput

field.description: List of Actions invoked by the handler
field.name: out_actions_taken

field.description: Process Name used to generate process title
field.name: tmp_process_name

field.description: Augmented Process Title
field.name: tmp_process_title

field.description: Fault Alert Handler Configuration retrieved from the provider
field.name: tmp_alert_configuration

field.description: Temporary output for actions like ipd:setProcessTitle($temp.tmp_process_title )
field.name: tmp_script_out

field.description: URN mapping to set one of the supported configuration providess (simple http get or Github gist)
field.name: tmp_urn_configuration_provider

field.description: Default value for tmp_urn_configuration_provider, default is gist (the ( the github-gist-alert-configuration connection must be set)
field.name: tmp_urn_configuration_provider_default

field.description: URN mapping to set configuration url
field.name: tmp_urn_configuration_url

field.description: Variable to store configured Configuration provider
field.name: tmp_configuration_provider

field.description: Variable to store Configuration URL
field.name: tmp_configuration_url

field.description: Dafault Value for
field.name: tmp_urn_configuration_url_default

field.description: Email Notification Parameters
field.name: tmp_email_action_details

field.description: URN Defines Fallback Emil to be used by falback configuration
field.name: tmp_urn_fallback_email

field.description: Falback Mailto Email
field.name: tmp_fallback_email

field.description: Org ID must be stored in URN mapping on Agent
field.name: tmp_urn_environment_org_id

field.description: URN defines Environment such as Agent name or Cloud
field.name: tmp_urn_environment_name

field.description: URN to resolve base URI of the Cloud server is used to generate links to process console
field.name: tmp_urn_base_uri

field.description: IICS Org ID
field.name: tmp_org_id

field.description: Environment Name
field.name: tmp_environment_name

field.description: Base URI of Informatica Cloud Org
field.name: tmp_base_uri

field.description: When Any of the rules. evaluatte to true and is associated with Ignore Action then the Alert will ignore this fault
field.name: tmp_ignore_fault

operation.expression:
let $config := $temp.tmp_alert_configuration let $alert := $input.AlertDetails
(: Evaluate all rules and calculate conditions result and outcome for each rule, the reult field is boolean determining if corresponding action associated with rule shudl be invoked:) let $rulesEvaluated := for $rule in $config/rules/rule let $group-operator := $rule/operator/text() let $conditions := for $condition in $rule/condition let $guid := $condition/guid/text() let $fieldName := $condition/alert-field/text() let $fieldValue := $alert/element()[local-name() = $fieldName]/text() let $conditionValue := $condition/value/text() let $conditionNot := $condition/not/text() let $type := $condition/type/text() let $result := switch ($type) case "equals" return $fieldValue eq $conditionValue case "matches" return matches($fieldValue,$conditionValue) case "contains" return contains($fieldValue, $conditionValue) default return false() (:negate the conditions result when not is set to true :) let $resultOut := if ($conditionNot = 'true' or $conditionNot = '0' and not(empty($conditionNot))) then not($result) else $result return (:clone:) <condition> <guid>{$guid}</guid> <type>{$type}</type> <value>{$conditionValue}</value> <fieldValue>{$fieldValue}</fieldValue> <not>{$conditionNot}</not> <alert-field>{$fieldName}</alert-field> <result>{$resultOut}</result> </condition>
return <rule> <guid>{$rule/guid/text()}</guid> <name>{$rule/name/text()}</name> <operator>{$group-operator}</operator> {$conditions} {$rule/action} <results>{string-join($conditions/result/text(),",")}</results> <result>{ if (upper-case($group-operator) = "OR" ) then 'true' = $conditions/result else (: checking if value is in the sequence of results :) not( 'false' = $conditions/result) }</result> </rule> (: we need to decide which action to invoke following logic is applied Eachr Rulee is associated with action that will be invoked or ignore action will be applied to specific rule When Any rule is true with Ignore Action all other actions will be dismissed as well (ignore action is mutually exclusive with any other actions Make sure you design rules in the way that no duplicate actions is taken two rules linked to the same action will invoke action only once If any other action will be supported such as external event trigger, it would be possible to combine it with email actions and they would execute in parallel currently email actions will be invoked sequentialy as the rules evalueted themor we will ignore the error, send Warning or Error level email :)
(: get distinct set of actions - find all rules with true result and their actions:) let $distinct-actions := $rulesEvaluated[result/text() = 'true']/action/guid
let $invokeActions := for $action in $config/actions/action (: is value in sequence:) where string($action/guid/text()) = $distinct-actions return $action
return <FaultAlertConfiguration> {$config/alert-config} <rules> {$rulesEvaluated} </rules> {$config/actions} <invokeActions>{$invokeActions}</invokeActions> </FaultAlertConfiguration>

assignment.title: Update Process Title - Failed Get Snippet

operation.expression: <FaultAlertConfiguration> <alert-config> <Name>Default Falback Alert Configuration</Name> <Description>This is fallback configuration sending all Faults as errors in case that the Alert configuration is not loaded from the Config provider</Description> <created>2019-06-21T10:24:23</created> <createdBy>System</createdBy> </alert-config> <rules> <rule> <guid>9e7b7b98-f7ce-43e1-911f-26b4aaa0506a</guid> <name>Error Email</name> <operator>OR</operator> <condition> <guid>159ccd35-f8a0-433e-82ca-7dea2df10f3e</guid> <type>equals</type> <value></value> <not>true</not> <alert-fied>processName</alert-fied> </condition> <action> <guid>dcc33ba3-9ced-4546-a6e0-e9c1b33ae767</guid> <Name>Error Email</Name> <Type>error-email</Type> </action> </rule> </rules> <actions> <action> <guid>dcc33ba3-9ced-4546-a6e0-e9c1b33ae767</guid> <Name>Error Email</Name> <Description>Send Fatal Error level Email - use for Critical errors that need immediate attention. or unexpected errors</Description> <Type>error-email</Type> <ActionDetail> <action-email> <subject>Fault Alert - Error</subject> <to>{$temp.tmp_fallback_email}</to> <cc></cc> <bcc></bcc> <contentType>text/html</contentType> <actionName>Send Error Email</actionName> </action-email> </ActionDetail> </action> </actions> </FaultAlertConfiguration>

assignment.title: Update Process Title Warning - Invalid Config

operation.expression:
let $index := xs:int($temp.tmp_email_actions_index) let $email-config := $temp.tmp_email_actions[$index]
(:when EMAIL Details are not resolved than we return falback default :) return if (not(empty($email-config/ActionDetail/action-email))) then $email-config/ActionDetail/action-email else <action-email> <subject>Fault Alert - Error</subject> <to>{$temp.tmp_fallback_email }</to> <contentType>text/html</contentType> <actionName>Fallback Email Config</actionName> </action-email>
